qas.question: What is the definition of a Nucleo?
What is located at the northern end of Bandeirante?
What did the cuperquadras plan to build near the lake shore?

context: <b5_0>Both low-cost and luxury<b5_0/> housing were built by the government in the Brasília. The residential zones of the inner city are arranged into <b6_0>superquadras<b6_0/> ("superblocks"): <a0_0><b7_0>groups of apartment buildings along with a prescribed number and type of schools, retail stores, and open spaces<b7_0/><a0_0/>. At <a1_0>the northern end of Lake Paranoá<a1_0/>, separated from the inner city, is <b8_0>a peninsula<b8_0/> with many fashionable homes, and a similar city exists on the southern lakeshore. Originally the city planners envisioned <a2_0><b9_0>extensive public areas<b9_0/><a2_0/> along the shores of the artificial lake, but during early development <a3_0>private clubs, hotels, and upscale residences and restaurants<a3_0/> gained footholds around the water. Set well apart from the city are satellite cities, including <a4_0>Gama, Ceilândia, Taguatinga, Núcleo Bandeirante, Sobradinho, and Planaltina<a4_0/>. These cities, with the exception of Gama and Sobradinho were not planned.
